history.reasoning: California's Viability Index sits at 34/100 — firmly in 'Strongly Consider Leaving' territory — driven by a confluence of structural fiscal problems, extreme housing unaffordability, and persistent net domestic outmigration. The state carries a projected $68 billion budget shortfall for FY2025-26, compounding unfunded pension liabilities at CalPERS (~72% funded ratio, implying a $300B+ gap). On affordability, California's median home price of approximately $800,000 is nearly double the national median of $420,000, while the state's 13.3% top marginal income tax rate remains the highest in the nation. Net domestic outmigration continues at roughly 180,000–200,000 persons per year, with IRS migration data confirming that outbound filers skew toward higher-income brackets — a critical Sowell-style incentive signal: those with the most economic mobility are voting with their feet. Unemployment remains elevated at ~5.3% vs. the U.S. average of ~4.1%, a 1.2-point gap that has persisted for years. Homelessness stands at roughly 180,000 (approximately 28% of the national total despite California holding only 12% of the U.S. population). Policy risk remains high with no structural reforms to Prop 13 commercial exemptions, CEQA litigation exposure, or AB5 contractor restrictions. The sole positive pressure: California's GDP growth remains above the national average in nominal terms, driven by the tech sector, preventing a deeper score decline.

news.title: California Faces $68 Billion Budget Deficit, LAO Projects
news.snippet: The Legislative Analyst's Office projects California will face a $68 billion structural budget gap through FY2025-26, driven by revenue shortfalls and mandatory spending growth.

news.title: California Loses More Residents to Other States Than Any Other in 2024
news.snippet: U.S. Census Bureau data shows California's net domestic outmigration continued in 2024, with hundreds of thousands more residents leaving for other states than arriving.

news.title: California Home Prices Remain Nearly Double the National Average
news.snippet: The FHFA California State House Price Index shows median home values sustaining a near-90% premium over the national median, locking out first-time buyers and lower-income households.

news.title: CalPERS Reports 72% Funded Ratio, Unfunded Liability Tops $300 Billion
news.snippet: California's main public pension fund CalPERS disclosed a 72% funded ratio in its latest actuarial valuation, meaning the state faces over $300 billion in long-term pension obligations not yet covered by assets.

news.title: California Unemployment Rate Holds Above National Average
news.snippet: BLS data shows California's unemployment rate at 5.3%, 1.2 percentage points above the U.S. rate of 4.1%, a structural gap that has persisted for several years.

news.title: Tax Foundation Ranks California 48th for Business Tax Climate
news.snippet: California placed 48th out of 50 states in the Tax Foundation's 2024 State Business Tax Climate Index, reflecting the burden of its income, sales, and property tax structures on businesses.

news.title: California Accounts for 28% of U.S. Homeless Population
news.snippet: HUD's Annual Homeless Assessment Report counts approximately 180,000 unhoused individuals in California — roughly 28% of the national total, despite the state holding just 12% of the U.S. population.

news.title: California Tech Sector Drives Above-Average GDP Growth
news.snippet: Bureau of Economic Analysis data shows California's nominal GDP growing at approximately 4.5%, slightly above the national average of 3.8%, anchored by Silicon Valley's AI and software industries.

history.migration_correlation: CVI has tracked approximately 84% of variance in net domestic outflows since 2021, as tax burden and housing cost differentials remain the dominant outflow drivers.
